co.sourse.pvnsdk

Class Sourse

  • java.lang.Object
    • co.sourse.pvnsdk.Sourse

  • public class Sourse
extends java.lang.Object

    Sourse SDK Integration Instructions

    Pre-Requisites

    An API endpoint URL and API key will be provided by Sourse.

    Configure Build System

    Add the Sourse repository and SDK dependency to the application build.gradle file. i.e. 

     
   repositories {
     ...other repositories
     maven {
         url "http://107.178.209.67:8081/nexus/content/repositories/releases/"
     }
   }
 and
   implementation 'co.sourse:sourse-push-video-sdk:{$version}'

    Add Initialisation Code

    Add the following to the onCreate() method of the host application's Android Application class or launch Activity: 

     
  // Optionally activate SDK logging
  Sourse.setDevBuild(true);
  Sourse.initialize(getApplicationContext(), "API ENDPOINT", "PROJECT KEY");
    The integration may be verified by turning on the logging and confirming:
    1. An info level log line containing the snippet Service Broker initialized and all services started appears shortly after the application is started and the initialize method was called.
    2. An info level log line containing the snippet SensationService - Sensation upload success appears shortly after an event is recorded using the recordEvent() method.

    Android Manifest

    The library Android manifest specifies the permissions that will be merged into the application manifest. It is necessary to declare the broadcast receiver in the application manifest as follows:

    <receiver android:name="com.incoming.au.sdk.notification.NotificationBroadcastReceiver"> <intent-filter> <action android:name="android.intent.action.DOWNLOAD_COMPLETE"/> <!-- Used to ensure multiple host applications using the SDK do not interfere with one another. --> <category android:name="${packageName}"/> </intent-filter> </receiver>

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(@NonNull
                              android.content.Context context,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String endPoint,
                              @NonNull
                              java.lang.String projectKey)
        Configure the Sourse SDK using the the PRESENTATION_PVN display method.
        Parameters:
        context - The application context. This must not be null.
        endPoint - the PVN API endpoint provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.
        projectKey - the project key provided with the PVN configuration. This must not be null.

      • setDevBuild

        public static void setDevBuild(boolean showDevInfo)

      • setUserId

        public static void setUserId(@Nullable
                             java.lang.String userId)
        Supply an optional external user id that may be used to join analytics data with other data sources. The id is persisted between between application sessions unless the user clears the application data.
        Parameters:
        userId - External user id; passing null will remove any user id that was set in the past

      • setNotificationDisplayActive

        public static void setNotificationDisplayActive(boolean displayNotifications)
        Enable/disable the display of notifications. Notification display is enabled by default.
        Parameters:
        displayNotifications - notifications will be displayed if true is passed

      • isNotificationDisplayActive

        public boolean isNotificationDisplayActive()
        Query if video prefetch and notifications are active.
        Returns:
        true if notification display is active

      • recordEvent

        public static void recordEvent(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> parameters)
        Record a generic, application-defined analytics event - used e.g. for custom analytics solutions
        Parameters:
        parameters - map containing the application event parameters. All keys in this map must be strings, and all values in the map must be strings, integers, longs, doubles, or booleans.

      • isApiLevelSupported

        public static boolean isApiLevelSupported()
        The Sourse SDK will not be started for any API level less than this. SDK methods may be called on older platform but no action will be taken.
        Returns:
        the minimum Android API level supported by the Sourse SDK.
